Story.p1: Developments are cultural, technological, and civic improvements to factions. Developments might be physical structures like a Mage Tower, scientific advancements such as Cartography, or even skilled groups of people, like Diplomats.

Developments may affect the faction directly, for example, by improving defensive capabilities or providing various sorts of troops for military conflict, or developments might affect the leaders and heroes associated with the faction, improving their abilities or giving them access to abilities they wouldn't have. These sorts of developments are like stunts, except they affect all characters from the faction, not just one.

The Stronghold builds developments by spending the resources they obtain, as detailed in the Seasons chapter. The Autarch gain new developments by allocating points to threat pools, also detailed in the Seasons chapter. The other minor factions don't build new developments, but rather have a set list.

Developments are described by the resource costs for building them (build points, food, timber, ore, luxuries, and mana), by a few tags (regional and technical) which can be applied to them, by the tech tree they belong to, and by their effect description. Developments may have different game effects depending on whether the Stronghold or another Faction has built them.

Developments with the regional tag are very closely related to a particular region. When these developments are built, they should be listed on the Stronghold sheet under a particular region where they will reside. Factions already have these developments listed in the regions they control. Regional developments allow duplicates to be built, with a maximum of one such development in each region. If a region containing a development is ever lost for some reason, the development is lost with it. If a region has a threat which prevents any production of goods, the development will also no longer function until the threat conditions are removed.

Developments with the technical tag are knowledge based developments which may be the target of Espionage missions. Successful Espionage missions reduce the cost of building technical developments by half, rounded down. See the Missions and Infiltration chapters for more details.

The developments are divided into five tech trees. There is one tech tree for each type of Conflict (Diplomacy, Infiltration, Skirmish, and Warfare) as well as a tech tree for Arcane developments. The four Conflict tech trees have effects which not surprisingly help in each of those four Conflict types, while the developments in the Arcane tech tree benefit spellcaster characters. The better developments in each tech tree have prerequisite developments in the tech tree which must be built first. The peak developments in each tree are difficult to obtain, and it will only be possible to at most build a few of them over the course of the campaign.

Developments may have different effects depending on whether they're used by the Stronghold or a faction. Many developments benefit characters directly, allowing them to gain benefits much like stunts. Only leaders and heroes from the Stronghold or faction in question may gain these benefits. Some developments give the Stronghold certain defensive capabilities to ignore threats. These developments work differently for factions. Instead of providing defensive capabilities, they function to set the overall difficulty for missions involving the faction.

As described in the Missions and Infiltration chapters, developments may be targeted through the use of the Espionage and Sabotage missions. Espionage missions target technical developments, and reduce the resources it takes to build them by half. Sabotage missions disable a development for a year, weakening the targeted faction.

When developments in the Warfare tech tree are targeted with Sabotage, only the developments is disabled. The faction or Stronghold does not lose any military units already recruited. Instead, the resources needed to train and develop units of the particular types have been disabled.
Arcane developments make channeling and casting spells far more effective.

Region provides one additional mana when calculating starting mana for bound casters. Does not provide any additional resources for developments or trade (don't increase the listed mana value on the region).
Step up the help die by one on spell effect rolls.
All heroes gain one Lore stunt. Must meet any stunt prerequisites.
Step up the help die by one on backlash checks.
Step up the help die by one on backlash checks.
May recruit battle mage units for warfare.
Step up the help die by one on spell effect rolls.
Step up the help die by one on spell effect rolls.
Step up the help die by one on backlash checks.
Improvents for the Stronghold and factions for missions using the Diplomacy Conflict.
Step up the help die on social die rolls when officially representing the Stronghold.
Stronghold: Ignore two diplomacy threats per year of Superb (5) difficulty or less.
Faction: The difficulty of all Diplomacy missions with the faction is Superb (5).
Step up the help die on social die rolls when officially representing the Stronghold.
Disposition increase takes three seasons of trade instead of four.
Add one stability to the Stronghold. The cost listed is multiplied for each region under the Stronghold's control.
Stronghold: Ignore three diplomacy threats per year of Fantastic (6) difficulty or less.
Faction: The difficulty of all Diplomacy missions with the faction is Fantastic (6).
Stronghold: Ignore one diplomacy threat per year of Great (4) difficulty or less.
Faction: The difficulty of all Diplomacy missions with the faction is Great (4).
Each hero gains two additional relationship aspects with leaders from other factions.
Step up the help die on social die rolls when officially representing the Stronghold.
Improvents for the Stronghold and factions for missions using the Warfare Conflict.
Stronghold: Ignore two infiltration threats per year of Superb (5) difficulty or less.
Faction: The difficulty of all Infiltration missions with the faction is Superb (5).
Step up the help die when leveraging a cover story.
Step up the help die when leveraging a cover story.
Stronghold: Ignore one infiltration threat per year of Great (4) difficulty or less.
Faction: The difficulty of all Infiltration missions with the faction is Great (4).
Stronghold: Ignore three infiltration threats per year of Fantastic (6) difficulty or less.
Faction: The difficulty of all Infiltration missions with the faction is Fantastic (6).
Step up the help die on rolls where thieves tools are useful.
Place two notecards on your turn when setting up the House during Infiltration.
Step up the help die on rolls where thieves tools are useful.
Step up the help die on rolls where thieves tools are useful.
Improvents for the Stronghold and factions for missions using the Skirmish Conflict.
Step up the help die when attacking with melee weapons.
Step up the help die when attacking with ranged weapons.
Step up the help die when attacking with melee weapons.
Stronghold: Ignore three skirmish threats per year of difficulty Fantastic (6) or less.
Faction: The difficulty of all Skirmish missions with the faction is Fantastic (6).
Step up the help die when defending against an attack.
Step up the help die when defending against an attack.
Step up the help die when attacking with ranged weapons.
Stronghold: Ignore two skirmish threats per year of difficulty Superb (5) or less.
Faction: The difficulty of all Skirmish missions with the faction is Superb (5).
Stronghold: Ignore one skirmish threat per year of difficulty Great (4) or less.
Faction: The difficulty of all Infiltration missions with the faction is Great (4).
Improvents for the Stronghold and factions for missions using the Warfare Conflict.
May recruit catapult units.
Stronghold: Step up help die on infantry Attack and Armor rolls. Also may ignore up to three Warfare threats each year if defending units outnumber attacking units.
Faction: Step up help die on infantry Attack and Armor rolls. The difficulty of Warfare missions with the faction is Fantastic (6).
May recruit archer units.
Swap out keep with a castle. May build one castle on each region. Factions targeting the region in Warfare must attack with at least one cannon unit.
May recruit cannon units.
May recruit cavalry units.
Place a keep on target region. May build one keep on each region. Factions targeting the region in Warfare must attack with at least one catapult or cannon unit.
Stronghold: May recruit infantry units for war. May ignore one Warfare threat each year if defending units outnumber attacking units.
Faction: Step up help die on infantry Attack and Armor rolls. The difficulty of Warfare missions with the faction is Great (4).
Stronghold: Step up help die on infantry Attack and Armor rolls. May ignore up to two Warfare threats each year if defending units outnumber attacking units.
Faction: Step up help die on infantry Attack and Armor rolls. The difficulty of Warfare missions with the faction is Superb (5).
